title: Central American Football Union
text:
The Unión Centroamericana de Fútbol (Central American Football Union), more commonly known by the acronym UNCAF, represents the national <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> teams of <a href="Central%20America">Central America</a>: <a href="Belize%20national%20football%20team">Belize</a>, <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a>, <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a>, <a href="Guatemala%20national%20football%20team">Guatemala</a>, <a href="Honduras%20national%20football%20team">Honduras</a>, <a href="Nicaragua%20national%20football%20team">Nicaragua</a>, and <a href="Panama%20national%20football%20team">Panama</a>. Its member associations are part of <a href="CONCACAF">CONCACAF</a>.
History.
Beginning.
The UNCAF was founded in 1990.
Competitions.
Overview.
The UNCAF organize various competitions, the <a href="Central%20American%20Cup">Central American Cup</a> is played every two years, starting in 1991, and usually feature the seven national teams. <a href="Costa%20Rica">Costa Rica</a> is the most successful team, winning the tournament eight times (1991, 1997, 1999, 2003, 2005, 2007, 2013, and 2014). <a href="Honduras">Honduras</a> have won the tournament four times (1993, 1995, 2011, and 2017). <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a> won the tournament in 2001, and <a href="Panama">Panama</a> won it in 2009. This tournament usually runs as a qualification round for the <a href="CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>.
The UNCAF also ran the <a href="Copa%20Interclubes%20UNCAF">Copa Interclubes UNCAF</a>, a competition for the champions and runners-up of the domestic leagues of the UNCAF members; <a href="C.D.%20Motagua">C.D. Motagua</a> (<a href="Honduras">Honduras</a>) was the last champion (<a href="Copa%20Interclubes%20UNCAF%202007">2007</a>). Similarly to the Central American Cup, this competition qualified three teams to the <a href="CONCACAF%20Champions%27%20Cup">CONCACAF Champions' Cup</a>. As it expanded into the CONCACAF Champions League in 2008, all of the Central American nations have at least one team and the Copa Interclubes UNCAF was disbanded.
Club teams.
UNCAF runs several competitions which cover men's, women's, youth and <a href="futsal">futsal</a>.
